alert.note: Alert for Broome (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:52AM EST until December 21 at 11:31AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Binghamton Washington Street. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flood waters cross Route 7 in Conklin near the Binghamton city line. Water also spreads into homes near Baltimore Avenue in Binghamton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 17.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. this evening at 900 PM EST.
